books.title: The Castle of Otranto
books.author: Horace Walpole
books.summary: A Gothic tale of chivalry, romance, and horror.

books.title: The Master of Ballantrae
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: The relationship of two noble brothers is blighted by hostility and vengeance in Jacobite Scotland.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Road to Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl takes a passerby down the road near her farm when they find themselves transported to another land.

books.title: Uneasy Money
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: When Lord Dawlish unexpectedly comes into an inheritance, he travels from London to New York to try to give it away.

books.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two best friends become involved in a love triangle.

books.title: The Princess and the Goblin
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: A princess and her young friend valiantly fend off a goblin attack with help from a ghostly relative.

books.title: The Slaves of Paris
books.author: Émile Gaboriau
books.summary: A group of blackmailers play a long game on several families.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: The complete U.S. public domain short fiction of horror legend H. P. Lovecraft.

books.title: Seven Pillars of Wisdom
books.author: T. E. Lawrence
books.summary: T. E. Lawrence’s memoir of leading the Arab revolt against the Ottoman empire during World War I.

books.title: Lost Man’s Lane
books.author: Anna Katharine Green
books.summary: A citizen detective investigates mysterious disappearances in an isolated village.

books.title: The Social Contract
books.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
books.summary: Rousseau explores the political philosophy of authority originating from the consent of the people.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Songs of the Cattle Trail and Cow Camp
books.author: John A. Lomax
books.summary: A collection of cowboy poetry collected by folklorist John A. Lomax.

books.title: Zuleika Dobson
books.author: Max Beerbohm
books.summary: A beautiful magician unsuspectingly casts her charms on quiet Oxford.

books.title: The Stainless Steel Rat
books.author: Harry Harrison
books.summary: An intergalactic thief tries life on the side of the law.

books.title: Mr. Mulliner Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of short stories featuring the eccentric (and hilarious) Mr. Mulliner, who regales the patrons of the Anglers’ Rest with tales of his colorful and amusing relatives.

books.title: The Imitation of Christ
books.author: Thomas à Kempis
books.summary: Thomas à Kempis provides instructions for a Christian spiritual life.

books.title: The Innocents Abroad
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain travels abroad, offering witty observations on the places and cultures he encounters and commentary on the habits and foibles of his fellow travelers.
